title: About Me
text:
Hello! I’m Caleb, a fourth-year undergraduate student at UCLA majoring in Statistics & Data Science.
I’m passionate about using data-driven insights to solve real-world problems, particularly in machine learning, NLP, and predictive analytics.
I love working on projects that blend storytelling with data—whether it’s analyzing trends in movies, building recommendation systems, or exploring cutting-edge AI models.
Beyond academics, I enjoy learning new languages, going to concerts, and exploring cafes around LA!

title: Caleb Williams
text:
Projects

1. Recipe Recommendation App
Python


Used Scrapy to webscrape 10,000+ recipes, nutritional info, reviews from allrecipes.com

Cleaned and stored data with Pandas and Sqlite3

Implemented Dash web app that provided recipe recommendations based on user-input ingredients, preferences, and cook times




2. Textual Analysis of Romantic Comedies
R & Python


Analyzed 30 popular rom-coms from the last 40 years to explore predictability trends across decades

Compared textual content using word clouds, lexical diversity metrics, and N-gram pairwise correlations

Examined cross-decade sentiment shifts and applied clustering analysis & LDA topic modeling

Built a random forest model and compared its predictive performance against a DistilBERT model
